response.answer_text: It’s hasn’t been confirmed or denied that Harry is bisexual, which means that everything is based on subtle details from the books. I personally think J.K. Rowling only accidentally made Harry bi, but I’m disregarding her intentions. He’s definitely not homosexual, having shown obvious interest in Cho in Ginny. He never explicitly states that he has a crush on any male characters (although, it takes him an extremely long time to confront his crush on Ginny, which hints that he could just not realize he’s bisexual). However, he does repeatedly state several boys as handsome, probably more so than he does with girls. He also develops unusual interest in some of the boys that he consistently describes as attractive. Cedric: I firmly believe Harry had a crush on Cedric. He didn’t realize it, but he didn’t recognize his crush on Ginny for a very long time, either. He was very blatant about how handsome he found Cedric. He was also very shaken up when he died. It was understandable, considering it was the first death he saw, but it had more effect on him than any other character’s death seemed to have, even though they weren’t very close. Draco: If we compare Harry’s crushes on girls with boys, we can see some similarities. When Harry is attracted to a girl, he grows slightly obsessive (like in the Deathly Hallows, when he watches Ginny on the Marauder’s Map, or when he’ll watch Cho Chang in the Great Hall). He also wants to impress them. Both of these things happen with Draco Malfoy, who Harry grows completely obsessed with in the Half-Blood Prince. He also cares a lot about how he acts around Draco. Tom: Harry describes Riddle as “handsome” and “charming” many times, whenever he sees Riddle in the Pensieve or diary. In the Chamber of Secrets, he immediately trusts Riddle, even after receiving several hints that he’s untrustworthy. Bill: Honestly, how many times does Harry have to mention how handsome Bill is? He also describes Bill to be handsome in an edgy way, which I don’t think is something most straight boy think. Clearly, since Rowling hasn’t confirmed Harry’s sexual preference, it’s impossible to be sure he’s bisexual, but I think the clues in the books suggest that Harry is attracted to both men and women.

I am not sure but you could certainly make the case that he actually is. Harry does notice the looks of other men more than most straight guys would. I give some examples: Teenage Tom: “His was the most handsome face.” Young adult Tom: “His hair was a bit longer than it had been at school and his cheeks were hollow but all this suited him well. He looked more handsome than ever.” I am laughing so hard because Harry did the same with Tom’s dad: “Ogden collided with the glossy chestnut horse ridden by a very handsome dark-haired young man”. Cedric: “Cedric Diggory was an extremely handsome boy of around seventeen.” Sirius: “He was carelessly handsome, his slightly arrogant face so much younger and happier than Harry had ever seen it”.
